results.title: Where I came from and where I am going!
results.creator_credit: Michelle Tobin and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Michelle’s girls have motivated her and given her the strength to know herself. Michelle is a Yorta Yorta woman who has HIV, who loves her land and loves her girls.

results.title: The Giving tree
results.creator_credit: Charlie O. Hayward, Nick Bosustow, Shel Silverstein and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description: This poignant story about the relationships between a boy and a tree illustrates some truths about the meaning of giving, receiving and love. the tree unselfishly offers itself to the boy for climbing, for shade and for pleasure. But as the boy grows up his life takes him further and further away from the tree. But old age brings their relationship full circle. Based on the book by Shel Silverstein. Music and narration by Shel Silverstein. Animation by Charlie O. Hayward.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Charlie O. Hayward, Nick Bosustow, Shel Silverstein and Stephen Bosustow Productions

results.title: The Glacier climbers
results.brief_description: The story of a four day mountain journey from Westland to Canterbury across the Southern Alps. At Malte Brun Hut the climbers meet Sir Edmund Hillary and the parties combine for the last stage of the journey down the Tasman Glacier to the Hermitage, Mount Cook. Includes some spectacular mountain scenes.
results.description: The story of a four day mountain journey from Westland to Canterbury across the Southern Alps. At Malte Brun Hut the climbers meet Sir Edmund Hillary and the parties combine for the last stage of the journey down the Tasman Glacier to the Hermitage, Mount Cook. Includes some spectacular mountain scenes.

results.title: A Short story about love
results.creator_credit: Karen Wootton and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Karen is young, travelling and in love. When she returns from her travels she discovers she has HIV and with this diagnosis her life changes. Karen must come to terms with life’s new circumstances as she laments the fact that she may never have another relationship or be a mother. But life does move on for Karen and with the help of friends and family, Karen finds love again.

results.title: No more funerals
results.creator_credit: Michelle W and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Michelle is diagnosed with HIV in the early 80’s. She reflects on how treatments have improved over the years and celebrates the fact that she no longer attends as many funerals.
results.description: Michelle is diagnosed with HIV in the early 80’s. She reflects on how treatments have improved over the years and celebrates the fact that she no longer attends as many funerals.

results.title: Healing
results.creator_credit: Judith Odgers and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Judith is teaching in Thailand as a young teacher. It is an extraordinary cultural experience and also life changing as Judith is diagnosed with HIV. This story delves into the psyche of a young woman coming to terms with the taboos and limitations of the virus she has contracted.

results.title: Gary's story
results.creator_credit: Richard Michalak, Ray Argall, Rolf De Heer and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Gary is between girlfriends. When he meets Sally in the supermarket he discovers that she is between boyfriends so he asks her out.
“What about a cup of coffee?”
“I don’t drink coffee.”
“Tea, then?”
“I don’t believe in stimulants.”
“Milk?”
“Creates mucus.”
From this high point their relationship deteriorates. But Gary’s story has a happy ending – eventually.
